Transcript:
Edmund: Lorelei? If this is her idea of a joke. Lorelei! 
Lorelei: Be right out! 
Edmund: Thank you. I bought you some clothes. All the designers Beth
used to wear. Classic, sophisticated. I know you said you wanted to approach 
her from the inside out, surely dressing like her can't hurt. 
Lorelei: I'm way ahead of you, Eddie. 
(Humming "Wedding March") 
Lorelei: Well, however that song goes. Not bad, huh? 
Richard: All right, Father Sullivan's on his way. 
Cassie: Okay. 
Richard: Found you. 
Cassie: Yes. You wore this. 
Richard: Yes, I did. 
Cassie: For your christening. 
Richard: And my father and his father before him. 
Cassie: And now our son is going to wear it, too. 
Richard: You know, I do apologize that we have to have the ceremony 
here. 
Cassie: Oh, no. It's not your fault the earthquake destroyed the 
chapel. It's 
okay. 
Richard: But you know, if you wanted to hold off, you know, if you 
wanted something more formal as an occasion. 
Cassie: No, no, no. I want to keep this small and simple. I don't want 
the 
media asking us a whole bunch of questions. I just want to... I want to savor

the moment, and I want to celebrate the arrival of our little boy. 
Richard: That's exactly how I feel. I'm thinking we can have another

ceremony for your family and anyone else who wants to attend later. 
Cassie: Okay. Thank you. 
Richard: For what? 
Cassie: For guiding me to this point and helping me see that this was 
the 
right thing to do. I mean, I was so opposed to adoption and now I am... I am 
so happy that we are. 
Dax: Have my driver bring the car around front, I'll be out in a 
moment. 
Mrs. Mayhew: You're leaving? But the christening is just about... 
Dax: There may not be a christening if I can get to Alonzo in time. 
Mrs. Mayhew: Colonel, wait. If you talk to Alonzo, what will you say to

him? 
Dax: Whatever I have to. The monarchy comes first, Mrs. Mayhew. To 
restore it, to preserve it. 
Mrs. Mayhew: Ye c colonel, I agree. But Cassie and Richard have already

lost one child. Finally they are happy again. Once you tell Alonzo about this

baby... 
Dax: I don't like it any more than you do, dear lady. The last thing I 
want 
is to hurt Richard and Cassie, but we have no choice. 
Blake: So I showed up at Ross's class to surprise him and there he was,

with his arms around a female student. 
Holly: Giving her the Heimlich maneuver? 
Blake: No, he was comforting her. She was upset. 
Holly: All right. 
Blake: It is all right. I know her-- Tory granger-- and she's a very 
earnest, 
bright young woman and Ross believes she has the makings of an amazing 
lawyer. That's why he was upset. 
Holly: Why? 
Blake: Well, because she has money problems and she can't make her 
tuition, so when I heard about her predicament, I thought that I could help...

What? 
Holly: You're not jealous? 
Blake: (Scoffs) oh, please, mother. I am so far above being jealous 
now. 
I mean, really. The only thing that I thought of when I saw Ross and this girl

together was... All right, I'd kill her. I'll tear her from limb to limb and 
then 
I'm going to kill him, too. 
Buzz: Yikes. I hope this violent streak came from your father's side.

Holly: Don't count on it. Thank goodness for that reaction. For a 
second 
there, I thought you'd become superhuman. 
Blake: (Clears throat) it was an involuntary whim lasting but a mere

millisecond, and then I reverted to my calm, rational self again. 
Holly: I think it was a perfect reaction. 
Blake: Oh, listen, it turns out that Tory's problem becomes my 
solution. At 
my suggestion, Ross is hiring her as his legal assistant. Now she can afford to

pay her tuition and Ross doesn't spend so many hours at the office and he 
spends more time with me. 
Holly: I am impressed. You truly have evolved. 
Blake: Think so. 
Buzz: What, did you rob a library? 
Reva: Actually, I was hoping to find some little corner I can hide away 
in. 
(Laughs) oh, right here. This is great. 
Buzz: I'll bring you some coffee. I think you're going to have to stay

awake for a while. 
Holly: Thanks Buzz. 
Reva: Okay, so I took your suggestion and I went and got all these 
reference books on American art history and the civil war. 
But there's not a single thing in any of these that even closely resembles my

canvas, or Madame X. 
Blake: Madame who? 
Holly: She bought a painting, a portrait. 
Blake: Of a woman? 
Reva: Yes. But not just any woman. It's a portrait of Olivia, over a 
century 
ago. 
Alan: Well, Olivia, your timing could not be more perfect. I was just

updating Josh on our relationship. 
Olivia: Look, Josh, I don't know what he told you, but... 
Josh: Actually, he told me that you've secured new financing for the 
harbor 
project-- a group of private investors. 
Olivia: Right. Yeah. 
Josh: Well, I think that's great. I just wish you'd told me first. 
Olivia: I'm... I'm s --
Josh: But it's okay, I forgive you. Especially since Alan is our major

investor. 
Alan: Was your major. I am now just a minor player. 
(Cell phone rings) 
Josh: Excuse me. Excuse me. 
Olivia: Okay. 
Josh: Yes, Josh Lewis. Did you not get my message? 
Alan: You look a little uncomfortable. 
Olivia: What would you have said to him if I hadn't shown up when I 
did? 
Alan: Why do you ask that? Do you think I have something besides 
business to discuss with Josh? 
Olivia: No, you don't have anything else to discuss with him, but since

you've lost your hold over me, you might be feeling a bit vindictive and want

to retaliate, Alan, and that would be very, very foolish. 
Alan: Foolish would be you not returning to my bed, because I know you

want it as much as I do. 
Josh: What is it you want?
Alan: Olivia wants what I want-- what we all want: The harbor project 
to 
be a big success where we can make a lot of money. 
Josh: Well, that sounds good to me. 
Alan: Yes. So she has secured the future of the project by finding 
additional capital. So instead of ruling the roost, I will just be another 
rooster 
in the pen. I feel a little displaced, but I know it's good business. 
Josh: Well, Alan, you'll get the same return on your money no matter 
how 
many roosters there are in the pen, right? 
Alan: Well, actually I've already started reaping some of the rewards. 
You 
have a very talented wife. 
Josh: Yes, I know that. 
Alan: She's enthusiastic, very driven and has a gift... 
Olivia: Hey, you know what? I appreciate this, but I don't feel 
comfortable 
with all the flattery. 
Alan: I like to give praise where praise is due, but I do have another

appointment, so if you two will excuse me, I will be off. 
Josh: Is there something you want to tell me? 
Olivia: Such as? 
Josh: Well, such as why it is you felt you had to make an end run 
around 
Alan Spaulding? 
Olivia: Oh, I... 
Josh: You know what? That's okay, though. I don't care. I think it's 
one 
of the best things you've ever done. 
Reva: I don't want to be drawn to Olivia. I don't want to have anything 
to 
do with Olivia, but every time I try to escape her, I can't. 
Blake: Well, maybe it's yourself you're trying to escape. 
Reva: Sorry? 
Blake: Do you believe in past lives? The theory that we've been born 
and 
died over and over again? 
Reva: You mean karma? The life cycle kind of thing? 
Holly: You mean something more specific. 
Reva: Hey, I believe in a lot of psychic phenomena, but past lives? 
That's 
a little too farfetched. 
Blake: No, the theory behind past lives is the life we led before 
shapes the 
life we're leading today. 
Reva: The past isn't dead, it isn't even past. 
Blake: The circle of friends never really changes around you until you

work out whatever karma you're supposed to work out with them. Now, for 
instance, let's say you had a former life with Olivia? You could go back to that

life... 
Reva: Through hypnosis? 
Blake: Yes. And you could explore your relationship with her then and

maybe gain insight to help you today. 
Reva: Okay. I'm game. 
Holly: Uh, uh, uh. 
Reva: I am. I'll try anything once. I will. So, where do I go to get

hypnotized? 
Blake: Well, you could try it with me. You could start... I actually 
did 
some research on this for a book idea at one point, and I sat in some sessions,

and I know what to do. 
Reva: Great! Let's do it. Only let's not do it here. Let's go back to 
my 
place. Let's go. 
Holly: I'll go with you. As a journalist, I won't say a word. 
Blake: Okay. You keep your mind open and your mouth shut. 
Reva: See you, Buzz. 
Buzz: See you. 
Hi, Michelle. 
Michelle: Hi. 
Danny: Hey. 
Michelle: Miss me? 
Danny: Whoa. Careful, my wife's going to be here any minute. 
Michelle: Oh, cute. Keep that up and I'm not going to show you what's 
in 
this bag. 
Danny: I already know what's in the bags. 
Michelle: No, you don't. 
Danny: Yeah, I do. It's all that surveillance equipment that I asked 
you to 
get from New York. 
Michelle: Yeah, that's what's in this bag. But in this bag we have some

purchases of a more intimate nature. 
Danny: Oh, I see. Woo, woo, woo. Woo, woo, woo. All right, that we 
can keep. That stuff we're going to have to return. 
Michelle: You said something about the sting being off on the phone?

What's up? 
Danny: Yeah. Well, I pretty much figured out who the so-called mob big

shot is, who Carlos claims is behind the Spaulding scheme. 
Michelle: Mr. Steal-me-25-million-or-die? 
Danny: Yeah, well, it's not a mister. It's Carmen. She's free. She cut 
a 
deal with the feds. 
Michelle: What? 
Danny: Mm-hmm. Oh, she didn't get free by doing nothing. She ratted 
somebody out. 
Michelle: Who? 
Danny: Who do you think? 
Michelle: You. You. Of course. 
Danny: The only problem is, they don't have a case against me, so she's

trying to give them one, and the Spaulding heist would be a perfect setup. If I

were to go through with it and get caught, they could nail me. 
Michelle: That disgusting... 
Danny: Yeah, right. Yeah. I mean, no big surprise that she would send

me to prison, but would she go so far as to kill me if I refuse the job? Who 
knows? So, I'm calling her bluff. I told Carlos to forget about it. I'm not 
going to do it. 
Michelle: Oh, boy. Okay. Then what? 
Danny: Then what? We'll find out. 
Lorelei: Cat got your tongue? 
Edmund: How... Where... where did you...? 
Lorelei: I surfed the web. You know, there's half a dozen sites devoted 
to 
you and your prissy Princess, and they got loads of pictures of your wedding.

There's even a site where you can buy a knock-off of her dress, so I did. I 
mean, you said that if I dress like her, maybe it'd help me act like her. So, 
how 
am I doing so far? 
Edmund: It's... Oh. It's uncanny. 
Lorelei: Well, it gets better. One of them sites had a video of you 
guys 
saying your vows, so I played it over and over again, so I could get the sound

of her voice. You ready? 
Edmund: Okay. 
Lorelei: I promise to love, honor and cherish you, until death us do 
part. 
This is my solemn vow. So, what do you think? (Laughs) Eddie? 
Edmund: If I didn't know better... 
Lorelei: Am I good or what? (Laughs) 
Edmund: It's remarkable. You're Beth. 
Richard: It's so nice to see you smiling again. 
Cassie: Well, it's nice to be smiling again.  
(Telephone rings) 
Richard: Yes? Oh, great. Would you please ask colonel Dax to join us?

Great. Thank you very much. All right. Father Sullivan's on his way. 
Cassie: Okay. Well, I'm going to get little William dressed. 
Richard: Okay. 
Cassie: I wanted to talk to you about something first. 
Richard: What? 
Cassie: I was just... I was a little uncomfortable with how we 
approached 
this whole thing. 
Richard: What do you mean? 
Cassie: I just... There are a lot of good, decent people out there that 
have 
been waiting years to adopt a baby, and it just feels like we jumped right in

front of them, and we did it private... In private, because of who we are. Not

to mention the fact that, you know, we took the mother's word for it that the

father had no interest whatsoever in this baby, and then, you know, the judge

just signed off on the papers and everything just went through. 
Richard: So? 
Cassie: Not that I think that we did anything wrong, I just think that 
we're 
a little close. 
Richard: You don't feel good about this? 
Cassie: No. But... 
(Richard sighs) 
Cassie: Can I be honest with something? I

don't care. I don't care. I mean, call me selfish, but I want this baby. I want

him so bad. And you knew it before I did. I mean, you knew exactly what I 
needed and you did everything you could to make it happen for me, Richard, 
and I will love you forever for it. Forever. 
(Knocking at door) 
Cassie: Father 
Sullivan. 
Richard: Come in. Mrs. Mayhew. 
Mayhew: I'm interrupting. 
Richard: No, no. 
Cassie: No, no, no. No, no, you're not. I have to go get our son 
dressed. 
Excuse me. 
Richard: Mrs. Mayhew, as you have probably heard, we are christening

our new son today. 
Mayhew: Yes, I heard about that and I am terribly happy for you. 
Richard: You're happy? Have you to thank for that. 
Mayhew: Oh, well, hardly. 
Richard: Mrs. Mayhew, you brought William into our lives, and well, we

were hoping that you would share in our joy by participating in the ceremony 
today. 
Mayhew: I'd be honored, sir. 
Richard: Splendid. Well, it'll just be the three of us, and the 
children, of 
course. And colonel Dax. You haven't seen him, have you? I can't find him 
anywhere. 
Mayhew: Uh. 
Dax: Excuse me. I hear Alonzo Baptiste has returned from his tour at 
sea. 
Can you tell me where I might find him? 
Bartender: The docks, probably. Unless he's already gone again. 
Dax: Gone? Where? 
Bartender: He's feeling down, lately. His wife dumped him, so he 
shipped 
out for another tour. 
Dax: No. 
Cassie: Well, you now, Tammy, you're going to have to be a role model

for two younger brothers now. 
Tammy: Uh-oh. They're in big trouble. 
Cassie: No. You're a great big sister. You are. And I want you guys to

know that it's not going to take anything away from you now that William's 
going to be a part of our family. 
Richard: And your mother and I are going to love you as much as we ever

have. Even more, if that's possible. 
Cassie: Yes. You're going to get just as much of attention and you're

going to drive us nuts. 
Tammy: I already know that. I'm just as happy as you are about this.

Cassie: Great. Because we're really happy about this. 
Priest: Mr. President? 
Richard: Yes. Where's Dax? 
Dax: I'll try to head Mr. Baptiste off at the docks. If he should 
return, 
have him call me immediately. 
Bartender: Hey, mister. Here he is now. 
Dax: You are Alonzo Baptiste? 
Alonzo: That I am. 
Dax: I hear you were going off to sea again. 
Alonzo: No maybes about it. I'm shipping out as soon as I leave Rawley

my contact information. Now, who are you and what are you doing here? 
Dax: I am here to tell you some extraordinary news, Mr. Baptiste. News

that will change your life forever. 
Josh: So, here's to putting Alan in his place. Very nice job. 
Olivia: Thank you. (Glasses clink) 
Josh: Tell me about these people. 
Olivia: People? 
Josh: The investors you found for the harbor project. Do I know them?

Olivia: No. No, you don't. And no one ever will. They want to remain

anonymous. 
Josh: Well, to the rest of the world, sure, but obviously not to me, so 
where 
are they from? What, Chicago, or...? 
Olivia: Um, no. They're from the west coast. They're venture 
capitalists 
who lost their shirts in the dot-com meltdown and they want a safer place to 
stash their cash. 
Josh: How did you hook up with them? 
Olivia: Made a few calls. You know, the group's not really formed yet.

Once they are, I'll give you bios on all the participants and we'll go over them

together. How's that? 
Josh: Okay, sounds great. 
Alan: Ah. 
Phillip: From your assistant. By the way, I am not your personal 
messenger. 
Alan: Well, I should hope not. You're far too surly. 
Phillip: Yes, I am. So why am I here? What is this, anyway? 
Alan: This is just some research material, that's all. 
Phillip: On what? 
Alan: I have some information for you, Phillip. Edmund Winslow has 
returned to Springfield. 
Phillip: Says who? 
Alan: The people I pay to be my eyes and ears. Now, he's at the 
Springfield inn. You see what being a good messenger will get you? 
Phillip: Well, you know why he's back? 
Alan: Yeah. I imagine he's back because he wants Beth's silver mine.

Phillip: And anything else that he can finagle. Including the money 
that I 
put in trust for her. You know what? I think maybe I should have a little chat

with him-- see if I can't convince him it would be in his best interest to give 
up 
that notion and get the hell out of town before I find a way to nail him for 
Beth's death. 
Alan: If only we could. 
Phillip: Oh, don't worry. I haven't given up on that. Not by a long 
shot. 
Thank you. 
Alan: You're welcome. So, Lewis holdings is a private investment group.

Identity of said investors held anonymously. Not for long. 
Michelle: Wait, wait, wait. They arrested Johnny Machado? 
Danny: Mm-hmm. Yep. 
Michelle: Wait. And you're sure that Frank is certain Carmen traded 
Machado for her freedom? 
Danny: Yeah, I'm certain. But honey... 
Michelle: Then your theory about Carmen can't be right. 
Danny: Honey, Machado is a big-time player. There's no way Carmen is

going to rat him out. He'd come after her. She'd be dead. Unless she's

Michelle: Well, then, once Carmen finds out you've said no... 
Danny: She's going to be angry. 
Michelle: Yeah. And she's going to be desperate. And she's going to try

to get leverage with us any way that she can. 
Danny: I don't know. 
Michelle: Robbie. 
Danny: He's fine. Hey, he's fine. I just called Meta right before you 
got 
here. 
Michelle: Yeah, and that was a whole 20 minutes ago, so... 
Danny: Why don't you use your cell phone? 
Michelle: My battery's dead. 
Danny: Well, use mine. Honey. 
Michelle: Excuse me. 
Man: No, excuse me.
Michelle: You see that guy over there in the leather jacket? Does he 
look 
familiar to you? 
Danny: No. Why? 
Michelle: I don't know. But there's something about him. 
Danny: Honey. 
Michelle: Maybe we should ask Buzz if he knows who he is. 
Danny: Michelle. 
Michelle: I talked to Meta. 
Danny: And everything's fine. 
Michelle: Everything's fine. And while I was on the phone, I made

Danny: What?

Danny: Why?

she's not behind this. 
Danny: Michelle, I already did that. 
Michelle: I bet she can't. 
Danny: I already did... No, honey. I'm calling her back. 
Michelle: No, Danny. We need to get all the information that we can at

this point to find out what we're up against. 
Edmund: (Chuckles) say it again, say it again. 
Lorelei: Oh, Lizzie, sweetie, you look so pretty in that dress. 
Edmund: (Laughs) what about Alan? 
Lorelei: Don't push me, Alan. 
Edmund: Um, um, your mother's birthday. 
Lorelei: February 25. 
Edmund: Jim's daughter's name. 
Lorelei: Susan! She loves to dance and she adores you. 
Edmund: (Laughs) all right, hold it. Who is this? 
Lorelei: Dr. Rick Bauer, all- around good guy. 
Edmund: (Laughs) all right, all right. Name. 
Lorelei: Harley Cooper, about to have Rick's baby, always been 
threatened 
by me. 
Edmund: All right. 
Lorelei: Your brother Richard. Boo, hiss. His wife, Cassie, sister of 
Reva, 
mother of Tammy and R.J. (Laughter) 
Edmund: It worked. Lorelei, I all paid off-- the preparations, 
everything. 
It worked, you did it, Lorelei. You're Beth. 
Lorelei: Then you better start calling me by my name, sugar. 
Edmund: I'm sorry, Beth. 
Lorelei: That's Princess Beth to you, bub. Oo-wee! I can't wait to see 
the 
look on Freddie's face when we have my coming out party. Is he going to 
freak or what? (Laughs) 
Edmund: Who's face? 
Lorelei: Freddie, you know? Fred. My rich ex. 
Edmund: Phillip. 
Lorelei: Huh? 
Edmund: It's Phillip! Phillip, Phillip, Phillip, for the 200th time!

Lorelei: Are you sure? Because I was practicing it the whole time you

were gone-- freed, freed, Freddie, freed. Are you sure? 
Edmund: Lorelei, get this through your southern fried brain: You can 
get 
every other aspect of Beth's life right-- 
every detail, her walk, her talk, the way she kisses-- but if you can't 
remember Phillip Spaulding's name, your name is mud! 
Lorelei: Why do I got such a block against that bozo? 
Edmund: I have no idea. Just correct it fast. Here. This is a photo of

Phillip Spaulding. Think "fill 'er up." Full lips. Philadelphia, I 
don't know. 
And I don't care. Think anything you want, use any bizarre mnemonic device 
you need, just get that bloody man's name right! 
Lorelei: Eddie, Eddie... Where are you going? 
Edmund: I'm going to calm down. 
Lorelei: Uh... 
Edmund: And yes, I will bring you back more food. 
Lorelei: Barbecue! From that little place we passed on third street.

Blake: Om... om... Sandalwood for clarity and lavender for calm. I want

you to take deep breaths. (Reva coughs) 
Holly: I think you left some of the cow dung in there. 
Reva: (Laughs) 
Blake: Shh. Reva? 
Reva: Mm? 
Blake: I want you to concentrate on your breath. 
Reva: Mm-hmm. 
Blake: Deep, deep, deep inhalations. And with each inhalation, I want 
you 
to breathe in the light. Breathe in the wisdom. And with each exhalation, you

Reva: Mm-hmm. 
Blake: Breathe deep. Open your eyes and speak. 
Reva: Spaghetti. 
Blake: Spaghetti. 
Reva: Mm. 
Blake: Now, that's interesting. Perhaps you were Italian in a former 
life? 
Reva: No. Perhaps I'm thinking I'm going to make spaghetti for Shayne

for dinner. (Laughter) sorry. I am, I'm sorry, but this just... This isn't 
working. 
Blake: I understand, but Reva, sweetie, you have to give it a chance.

Reva: I did. (Laughter) 
Blake: All right, quiet. Let's try another approach. Word association.

Reva: No. 
Blake: Yes. 
Reva: No! No, no, no. Blake, I'm sorry. I know I agreed to this, and I

appreciate the effort you've put into it, but this is just a little too far out 
for me. 
Holly: That makes two of us, darling. 
Reva: And I don't think that it was a waste of time, though. I mean, I 
know 
that this painting has something to do with my past and that I do have a 
connection to it somehow, but this isn't the way I'm going to find it, even 
though I don't know exactly how I'm going to find the connection.
Reva: So, I'm sorry I've been such a flake and that I've been a little 
off-
kilter ever since I laid eyes on that painting. 
Holly: Maybe you should just put it up in the attic and forget about 
it. 
Reva: No, Holly. No. I have to figure out why it is I found it, or why 
it 
found me. 
Blake: Well, I hope you do, and when you do, will you tell me, because

I'm so curious. But let me know if you ever want to try this again, because I

promise to help. 
Reva: You'll be the first one I call. (Laughter) bring the incense. 
Thanks. 
See you guys. 
Blake: See you. 
Reva: Is Blake right? The key to this mystery isn't so much who you 
were 
in the past, but who I was. Maybe I was you. Ugh, God, no, please. Not that. 
Come on, Reva, concentrate. What is it? What is the connection? Oh, good 
lord. Why didn't I see it before? 
Richard: I don't understand this. He's always punctual. 
Cassie: Well, why don't you try him on his cell phone? 
Richard: Maybe he's already here. Maybe he just hasn't gotten the 
message? 
Mayhew: Why don't I go look around the palace? 
Richard: That's all right, Mrs. Mayhew-- I'll phone down again. 
Mayhew: I'll look anyway. Oh, there you are. What happened? Did you...

Dax: I was... 
Richard: Dax, there you are. Good God, man, where have you been? 
Dax: I'm sorry, Richard. I was unavoidably detained. 
Richard: Never mind. Never mind that, you're here now, right, and 
everyone's waiting for us, so come along then. All right, father. All present

and accounted for. 
Cassie: Oh.
